welcome.title: Welcome to Device Triage Planner
welcome.content: This tool teaches you how to organize devices on your network for better security. We'll walk you through the key concepts step by step.

scenarioSelector.title: Choose a Scenario
scenarioSelector.content: Start by selecting a scenario. Each one simulates a different network environment with various devices that need to be organized.

zonesOverview.title: Understanding Trust Zones
zonesOverview.content: Your network is divided into four zones based on trust level. Each zone has different access permissions and security levels.

mainZone.title: Main Network Zone
mainZone.content: This is for your most trusted devices - personal computers, phones, and tablets that need full network access.

guestZone.title: Guest Network Zone
guestZone.content: Visitor devices belong here. They get internet access but can't see or reach your main devices.

iotZone.title: IoT Network Zone
iotZone.content: Smart home devices like cameras, thermostats, and speakers should be isolated here. These often have weaker security.

investigateZone.title: Investigate Zone
investigateZone.content: Unknown or suspicious devices go here for review. Keep them isolated until you determine what they are.

deviceCards.title: Moving Devices
deviceCards.content: You can drag devices between zones, or use the dropdown menu on each card to reassign them. Try organizing the devices based on their type and risk level.

riskMeter.title: Risk Score
riskMeter.content: This meter shows your current network risk level. Lower is better! The goal is typically to get below 35 points.

controls.title: Security Controls
controls.content: Toggle these security controls to further reduce risk. Each control addresses different vulnerabilities in your network.

explainPanel.title: Understanding Your Score
explainPanel.content: This panel explains why your score is what it is. Each item shows what's adding to your risk and hints at how to fix it.

complete.title: You're Ready!
complete.content: That's the basics! Try to get the risk score as low as possible by organizing devices into appropriate zones and enabling security controls. Good luck!
